text: sorry i was teaching a class today
i agree with screw searchkit
all good
what do you think your estimate on how long that’s going to take is going to be?
days? weeks?
also, what happened with the rec page? we get distracted with this? should we finish that first or no?
(i dont really care too much and am more excited about this thing than the rec page)
recs page -- still need 0-100 scores
if I get real scores to display I can finish that up in a day so I'd go for that.  search page I think is weeks, it's definitely higher complexity
the search page thing is wider and deeper than the recs page
k
yeah obv
idk if those are common enough terms but more layers and more complexity in building the ui
like I've got enough figured out on my own to take a first stab at everything but I think there are going to be some big questions to answer / problems to tackle before it goes live
for the rec or the search
the search
i think id like to see more design in general before spending the weeks on that
design in terms of what?
i just want to be sure we are on the same page in terms of what is being built
few weeks in the grand scheme of things is a decent amount of itme. if it’s like 3 days id just say do whatever then we can iterate from there
yeah that makes sense
I can make some UI mockups of some sort tonight, is that what you'd be looking for?
maybe that + breaking the task down into sections, cause you could easily work on some of the ES stuff if you want to
yeah
that would be good
prioritizing is another thing perhaps
i got the itch for user accounts again

actually last week I wasn't really sure where we left off in terms of the conversation, since initially it sounded like you only wanted to use ES for a few things but toward the end it sounded like you were going to entertain using it for more
i think we could replace postgres with ES entirely
i think the result would be that our website would be faster on anything dynamic
however, i could see “analytics” to be harder
like we saw the tally type stuff would be harder
what i’m thinking right now is we stand up postgres + es and have them in sync, and then when we have something we want to do we can figure out which is best.
though doing hybrid shit like some query in ES then doing something in postgres to get some more stats or something would be a nightmare
i was really impressed in the speed of ES for doing advanced search queries
and how little work it was to do
yeah ES is many times better for queries with filters
and we can do cooler stuff
I think if we figured out how to do JOINs with that plugin or whatever, it would basically just be tally that uses the db
i doubt that thing will work well
performance wise
i can imagine that just doing it in python might be better idk
I guess so
in terms of architecture I'm not even sure if the UI I should be making should be talking to ES at all
or if it should all just go through the API and have the python talk to ES
yeah im thinking the latter
ok this rec scores are fucked
ive been looking at it for the past 20min
i realized i changed the way it works and the scores are weird
yeah I was doing the former earlier for searchkit but now that I'm off it I think the latter is better
whats weird about them?
so before i calculated this score based on the affinity to one card to another card
i could have just divided by the number of cards i have in the deck and it would have scaled nicely i think
however, at some point i switched to have it look at both the affinities in commanders AND color identity
in order to merge those two lists i convert the scores to ranks (like top more recommended, second most recommended)
then i scale the rank lists based on whether the deck is more like the commander or like the color identity pool of cards
so it’s scaled ranks
you’ll see something like .5, .9, 1.1, 3.2, …
i have no idea how we’d convert that to something numerical
I'm not sure if I understand fully but in theory could you record a shit ton of values, see what the distribution looks like, then apply some function to it to make the range ~0-100?
so the problem is
before, the scores would go like
so there was a visible leap from 985 to 506

now at some point i lose that score and we end up with
1 2 3 4 5
oh I see, so you're saying the distance between ranks isn't meaningful
yeah
could you go back to the old method? lol
so i do 2 recommendations, one vs. commander and one vs. color identity
their scores came out different scales
so if i remove it i can bias on direction or another
i guess i could do a study to figure out what the bias is and adjust it (bias meaning that one number is generally bigger than the other, so it would get more weight)
what was the motivation for adding in color identity?
handling decks better that went against the strategy for the commander
for example, i had a scion of the ur dragon enchantress deck for a long time that got shitty recs
when is witched it that deck got good recs because there are plenty of 5c enchantress decks

it’s pretty cool, i check to see how much your deck “resonates” with the color id or the commander, and scales the ranks accordingly. so if my thing feels you are closer to the commander’s strategy it’ll make those ranks higher
meaning that the commander strategy cards get recommended first
i kinda want to publish a paper on my resonation thing, it’s pretty cool imo hehe
hah
that's one of the few remaining pieces of code where I'm like
no idea what's happening here
so that makes sense
it took me a good 15 min to remember
so i think we need to get around this somehow
I can always move forward with the rec page without scores, but I do think it'd be a lot cooler with scores
yeah
hmm
if you can figure it out
i wonder if i can generate some sort of score after the fact
we could always go back to %s
could show % seen for this commander and % seen for this CID even to make it more info than before
like 36% in this commander, 22% in this CID
i figured out how to compute those faster
than we were before
.. i think
would we also sort by that?
yeah sure. sometimes those number suck tho
like my marath enchantress deck has a bunch of low %s
seemed like some people were confused by sorting by synergy but displaying straight %
because enchantress is the minority strategy
so enchantresses presence is going to show like 4%, but it’ll be highly recd if i miss it
i figured it out
the scores
this is sweet
i think i made the recs better too

so i was able to get a  score by doing:       (commander rec score for card) / (sum of commander rec scores + sum of cid rec scores) + (cid rec score for card) /  (sum of commander rec scores + sum of cid rec scores)
i.e., the weightesd sum of the score for the commander rec and the cid rec (if the deck resonates more w/ the commander, its score will be weighted higher)
NEXT, I divide by the number of cards because that seems to scale linearly
so i got rid of the rank bullshit and now just sort by score
